tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE security_camera_footage (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  camera_id INT,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  location VARCHAR(255),
  object_detected VARCHAR(100)
);

CREATE TABLE security_camera_footage (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  camera_id INT,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  location VARCHAR(255),
  footage_path VARCHAR(255)
);

CREATE TABLE security_cameras (
  camera_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  location VARCHAR(100),
  resolution VARCHAR(20),
  install_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE camera_footage (
  footage_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  camera_id INT,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  duration INT,
  file_path VARCHAR(255)
)

CREATE TABLE footage_metadata (
  metadata_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  footage_id INT,
  object_detected VARCHAR(50),
  confidence_score DECIMAL(5,2)
)

CREATE TABLE security_cameras (
  camera_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  location VARCHAR(100),
  installation_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE camera_footage (
  footage_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  camera_id INT,
  start_time TIMESTAMP,
  end_time TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE footage_metadata (
  metadata_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  footage_id INT,
  event_type VARCHAR(50),
  description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE events (
  event_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  camera_id INT,
  event_time TIMESTAMP,
  event_details TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE SecurityCameraFootage (
    camera_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    date_time TIMESTAMP,
    duration INTERVAL,
    resolution VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE CameraRecording (
    recording_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    camera_id INT,
    start_time TIMESTAMP,
    end_time TIMESTAMP,
    recording_file VARCHAR(255)
);
